title: Faraday effect
summary: The Faraday effect or Faraday rotation, sometimes referred to as the magneto-optic Faraday effect (MOFE),[1] is a physical magneto-optical phenomenon. The Faraday effect causes a polarization rotation which is proportional to the projection of the magnetic field along the direction of the light propagation. Formally, it is a special case of gyroelectromagnetism obtained when the dielectric permittivity tensor is diagonal.[2]
